ul.li1: 161 To mortals belong the plans of the heart,
ul.li2: but from Yahweh comes the answer of the tongue.
ul.li1: 2All the ways of a man are pure in his own eyes,
ul.li2: but Yahweh weighs the spirit.Or “breath”
ul.li1: 3Commit your work to Yahweh,
ul.li2: and your plans will be established.
ul.li1: 4All Yahweh has made is for hisOr “its” purpose,
ul.li2: and even the wicked for the day of trouble.
ul.li1: 5An abomination of Yahweh are all who are arrogant of heart;Or “mind”
ul.li2: rest assured,Literally “hand to hand” he will not go unpunished.
ul.li1: 6By loyalty and faithfulness, iniquity will be covered over,Or “atoned for”
ul.li2: and by fear of Yahweh one turnsLiterally “turning” from evil.
ul.li1: 7When the ways of a man are pleasing to Yahweh,
ul.li2: even his enemies he will cause to make peace with him.
ul.li1: 8Better is little with righteousness
ul.li2: than great income with no justice.
ul.li1: 9The mindLiterally “heart” of a person will plan his ways,
ul.li2: and Yahweh will direct his steps.
ul.li1: 10A decision is upon the lips of a king;
ul.li2: in judgment his mouth will not sin.
ul.li1: 11A balance and scales of justice belong to Yahweh;
ul.li2: all the weights of the bag are his work.
ul.li1: 12An abomination to kings is doing evil,
ul.li2: for by righteousness the throne will be established.
ul.li1: 13The delight of kings are the lips of righteousness,
ul.li2: and he who speaks what is upright he will love.
ul.li1: 14The wrath of a king is a messenger of death,
ul.li2: but one who is wise will appeaseOr “atone, cover over” it.
ul.li1: 15In the light of the face of the king there is life,
ul.li2: and his favor is like a cloud of spring rain.
ul.li1: 16Getting wisdom: how muchLiterally “what” better than gold!
ul.li2: And getting understanding: it is chosen overLiterally “from” silver.
ul.li1: 17The highway of the upright, it turns from evil,
ul.li2: he who guards himselfOr “soul,” or “inner self” keeps his way.
ul.li1: 18Before destruction comes pride,
ul.li2: and before a fall, a haughty spirit.Hebrew “a haughty of spirit”
ul.li1: 19Better a lowly spirit with the poor
ul.li2: than dividing the spoil with the proud.
ul.li1: 20He who is attentive to a matter will find goodness,
ul.li2: and he who trusts in Yahweh, his own happiness.
ul.li1: 21The wise of heartOr “mind” is called perceptive,
ul.li2: but he who is pleasant of lips will increase persuasiveness.
ul.li1: 22A fountain of life is wisdom for its owner,Or “master”
ul.li2: but the instructionOr “punishment” of fools is folly.
ul.li1: 23The heartOr “mind” of the wise will make his mouth judicious,
ul.li2: and upon his lips, itOr “he” will add persuasiveness.
ul.li1: 24Pleasant sayings are a honeycomb,
ul.li2: sweetness to the soul and healing to the bones.
ul.li1: 25There is a way that seems upright toLiterally “to the face of” a man,
ul.li2: but its end is the way of death.
ul.li1: 26The lifeOr “soul,” or “inner self” of a worker works for him,
ul.li2: for his hungerLiterally “mouth” urges him.
ul.li1: 27A man of wickedness concocts evil,
ul.li2: and his lips are like a scorching fire.
ul.li1: 28A person of perversity will spread dissent,
ul.li2: and he who whispers separates a close friend.
ul.li1: 29A person of violence will entice his neighbor
ul.li2: and cause him to walk on a way that is not good.
ul.li1: 30He who winks his eyes does so in order to plan perverse things;
ul.li2: he who purses his lips will bring evil to pass.
ul.li1: 31A crown of glory is gray hair;
ul.li2: by a righteous life it is gained.
ul.li1: 32He who is slow to angerLiterally “nostrils” is better than him who is mighty,
ul.li2: and he who controls his spirit than him who captures a city.
ul.li1: 33The lot will be cast into the lap,
ul.li2: but all of its decisions are from Yahweh.
